input_text:
Job Title: Sr Community Operations Manager

Location: Los Angeles, CA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
Our Company

Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen.

We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours!

The Community team is responsible for driving community engagement and relationship building, and advocating for customers within Adobe to support our product categories in partnership with a broad set of partner organizations.

The Senior Community Operations Manager will partner with the Sr. Director, Community and their leadership team drive and lead operational cadence across the Global Community team, serve as an advisor to the leadership team, and be responsible for business reporting and goaling. The ideal candidate possesses exceptional operational and program management skills, and motivational change leadership.

Responsibilities:

Establish and streamline team operations by setting standard methodologies, optimizing processes, and enhancing team coordination, engagement, and effectiveness. Identify improvement areas and provide actionable insights to boost clarity in performance and progress. Serve as a trusted advisor to the Senior Director of Community, aiding in strategic decisions and representing their interests in broader Marketing and Product discussions. Support the Senior Director in encouraging a balanced team culture, improving team communication, and promoting development across all organizational levels. Establish and handle infrastructure for business results reporting across media channels, track business goals, and handle reporting for planning and key events. Coordinate planning across various categories (Creative Imaging, Design, Video & Storytelling) and internal partners (Product Marketing, Social, Business Marketing). Oversee the operational cadence for the Community organization, including weekly leadership meetings, monthly All-Hands, and annual planning sessions, focusing on goal progress evaluation. Work with Marketing Centers of Excellence on cross-functional initiatives to ensure resource alignment, strategic vision coherence, and the clear, prioritized rollout of programs. Manage multiple concurrent projects and programs of varying sizes and complexities, spanning different teams, while proactively identifying and mitigating risks. 

Requirements:

Proven 10 years of experience in strategic and operational roles, with direct engagement with senior leaders and expertise in project management. Excellent ability to establish and maintain operations, comprehend all aspects of operations to drive improved solutions, and proactively design, implement, and lead change initiatives. Proven history as a self-starter capable of swiftly adapting priorities and maintaining focus on essential tasks with organized execution. Strong problem-solving skills with the ability to measure the effectiveness of community engagement across various channels, including organic and paid media, and events. 

Our compensation reflects the cost of labor across several U.S. geographic markets, and we pay differently based on those defined markets. The U.S. pay range for this position is $165,000 -- $214,000 annually. Pay within this range varies by work location and may also depend on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Your recruiter can share more about the specific salary range for the job location during the hiring process.

Our compensation reflects the cost of labor across several  U.S. geographic markets, and we pay differently based on those defined markets. The U.S. pay range for this position is $115,100 -- $245,300 annually. Pay within this range varies by work location and may also depend on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Your recruiter can share more about the specific salary range for the job location during the hiring process.

At Adobe, for sales roles starting salaries are expressed as total target compensation (TTC = base + commission), and short-term incentives are in the form of sales commission plans. Non-sales roles starting salaries are expressed as base salary and short-term incentives are in the form of the Annual Incentive Plan (AIP).

In addition, certain roles may be eligible for long-term incentives in the form of a new hire equity award.

Adobe is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and affirmative action employer. We do not discriminate based on gender, race or color, ethnicity or national origin, age, disability, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other applicable characteristics protected by law. Learn more.

Adobe aims to make Adobe.com accessible to any and all users. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation to navigate our website or complete the application process, email accommodations@adobe.com or call (408) 536-3015.

Adobe values a free and open marketplace for all employees and has policies in place to ensure that we do not enter into illegal agreements with other companies to not recruit or hire each other’s employees.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
